answers.author: Jared Cobb
answers.text:
I assume you mean a retention vote of the council. I've worked in four communities and am familiar with many others, and have never heard of such a requirement. In most communities the city manager is an at-will employee and can be fired (probably with severance pay) at any time.

answers.author: Betsy Holder
answers.text:
This is a retention vote by the electorate.  It was a charter provision added many years ago and there have been several attempts to repeal the provision but the voters have not chosen to do so thus far.  Another attempt may be made at the November 2013 election.

author: Betsy Holder
text: The Home Rule Charter for the City of Greeley, Colorado, includes a requirement that the City Manager stand for a retention vote every six years.  Are there other municipalities that have this unusual requirement?
title: City Manager retention vote requirement
